definition: to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: This was a period of great eclecticism.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个重要的折衷主义的时期。

sentences.english: In philosophy class, we're practicing eclecticism .
sentences.chinese: 哲学课上，我们连续用折衷主义分析题目。

sentences.english: In philosophy class, we're practicing eclecticism.
sentences.chinese: 哲学课上，我们连续用折衷主义分析问题。

sentences.english: The origins of structural theories are eclectic at best.
sentences.chinese: 结构主义理论的起源充其量也不过是折衷主义。

sentences.english: Hudec's Shanghai buildings are strikingly eclectic.
sentences.chinese: 邬达克在上海的建筑具有明显的折衷主义。

sentences.english: In this, as in so many other realms, eclecticism is misplaced.
sentences.chinese: 如此一来，正像其他许多领域一样，折衷主义行不通。

definition: Futurism (artistic and social movement of the 20th century)
harmonious combination of Chinese and Western elements (idiom)
